key_mistakes.reason: Delaying the development of the bishop and blocking the f-pawn.
Opening the center prematurely and losing tempo.
Capturing away from the center and weakening the pawn structure.
Checking aimlessly and losing the initiative.
Allowing black to consolidate and develop without pressure.
Missing the opportunity to activate the rook on the seventh rank.
Missing the opportunity to promote the pawn.

recommendations: Focus on developing pieces actively and controlling the center.
Avoid unnecessary exchanges that weaken your pawn structure.
Utilize open files and ranks to increase pressure on your opponent.
Prioritize moves that enhance piece coordination and maintain initiative.
